channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Pedestrian button to stop traffic not working, 28th February
item.description:
The button depresses and if held long enough the wait light triggers but then disappears after a few seconds. The traffic lights are not triggered to stop so pedestrians on that side of the road have to wait for someone crossing from the other side or risk crossing a very busy main road. Been present for at least a week but button started to fault (button managed to stay lit after a couple of attempts) at least 1 month ago. Very concerned that someone will get hit as this is near a bus stop and several lanes of traffic.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stanstead Road, Perry Vale, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Willesden Lane, 28th February
item.description:
Rubbish all over the street. There is rubbish everywhere as there are no bins and less people to help cleaning.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Willesden Lane, Kilburn, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Fly-tip Small - Less than one bag

item.title: Commercial bins overflowing led to rubbish strewn on Truman’s Road, 28th February
item.description:
As you can see, bin bags were piled high atop of the commercial bins on Truman’s Road, meaning when they were cleared by the bin men this morning they opened up and litter is now strewn all over the pavement and behind the bins too. Disgusting.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Salcombe Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
